title: 1506-D
statement: D. Epic Transformationtime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputYou are given an array $$$a$$$ of length $$$n$$$ consisting of integers. You can apply the following operation, consisting of several steps, on the array $$$a$$$zeroor more times:you select twodifferentnumbers in the array $$$a_i$$$ and $$$a_j$$$;you remove $$$i$$$-th and $$$j$$$-th elements from the array.For example, if $$$n=6$$$ and $$$a=[1, 6, 1, 1, 4, 4]$$$, then you can perform the following sequence of operations:select $$$i=1, j=5$$$. The array $$$a$$$ becomes equal to $$$[6, 1, 1, 4]$$$;select $$$i=1, j=2$$$. The array $$$a$$$ becomes equal to $$$[1, 4]$$$.What can be the minimum size of the array after applying some sequence of operations to it?InputThe first line contains a single integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \\le t \\le 10^4$$$). Then $$$t$$$ test cases follow.The first line of each test case contains a single integer $$$n$$$ ($$$1 \\le n \\le 2 \\cdot 10^5$$$) is length of the array $$$a$$$.The second line of each test case contains $$$n$$$ integers $$$a_1, a_2, \\ldots, a_n$$$ ($$$1 \\le a_i \\le 10^9$$$).It is guaranteed that the sum of $$$n$$$ over all test cases does not exceed $$$2 \\cdot 10^5$$$.OutputFor each test case, output the minimum possible size of the array after applying some sequence of operations to it.ExampleInput5 6 1 6 1 1 4 4 2 1 2 2 1 1 5 4 5 4 5 4 6 2 3 2 1 3 1Output0 0 2 1 0

processed.result: You are given a list of numbers. You can remove any two numbers from the list. What is the smallest possible length of the list you can achieve?

You are given an array of integers. You can remove any two different numbers from the array in any order. What is the smallest possible size the array can become after doing this repeatedly?

Input:

* The first line contains the number of test cases, $t$.
* For each test case:
    * The first line contains the size of the array, $n$.
    * The second line contains $n$ integers, representing the elements of the array.

Output:

For each test case, output the smallest possible size the array can become.
